m_szDocSumamry: Solar Impulse Flight #8 to Hawaii Halted on the Tarmac (Video) June 24th, 2015 by Amber Archangel   Originally published on  1Sun4All . Those of you who were watching the live takeoff coverage of Solar Impulse 2 (Si2) — the world’s first solar-powered plane able to fly day and night without a drop of fuel — from Nagoya, Japan, already know that the weather window closed as  André Borschberg  — CEO, cofounder, and pilot of Solar Impulse — was sitting in Si2 on the tarmac.
